title: Solder Art Music Coffee Beer Company
text:
Hi! Thanks for reading my post. I am known around the city by a lot of the museums and galleries. I attend lectures on a regular basis. I usually like the big names and famous people with international recognition. I enjoy lectures on art, physics, poetry and many other subjects. I sometimes talk a little rapidly, but for those with an interest in what I am talking about it usually is well received. For instance, this morning I was having a lovely exchange with a barista putting on a presentation on four types of coffee she was brewing and we discussed different types of beans a and brewing techniques. I also was talking with a lovely architect from Wisconsin and we were toe to toe in discussing the development in Washington, with different architects and developers. Then I briskly hung out at SAAM for some coffee, tea, and to ride their WIFI in the LUCE area of the gallery. Then, I ran to the NGA for a classical mandolin concert with an excellent percussionist, with a dessert of one of the last documentaries of a famous icon in filmography. This is actually being written unbeknownst to me in fictional form by a friend of mine trying to set me up. 

If you like to solder or stand in lines I'd love to buy your old solder gun, or pay you to stand in line for Congressional hearings/ All jokes aside, if you like art and running around the city I am always availed to company.

title: Catch 22
text:
This post if for my friend. Yes, I am a match maker like the movie, "Fiddler on the Roof." But, this is about him and not me.

6'2, thin swimmer's build, blond hair, with a very mild mannered look about him. He actually has great endurance too as he rides his bicycle to and from the city for arts and cultural events to include, tech start-ups, art receptions, conventions, ceremonies, independence days, lectures, etc. If it has a good reception, then more than likely he is interested. He also likes to memorize poetry and is able to recite it. He sells used books and frequents estate sales, libraries, and all sorts of places with dust and the smell of old things. You can also find him on Sunday at the flea market in Georgetown selling his jewelry which is another side job of his. He also does a d.j. show playing music of his choosing usually with some quirky poetic messages usually with strong female roles such as Goldfrapp.

I think, but I could have the wrong author, but he likes the Emily Dickinson look. WASPY, nerdish, plain, dry lips, a bit odd, awkward, au naturel in all ways, shy, people are somewhat his type. We recently saw a movie with Anne Heche and he found her short hair and disco dancing hot. 

He is somewhat in a "Catch 22" situation as he never approaches anyone, and the type of person he likes would never approach him. So, he is left memorizing this poetry with no one to recite it to.

text:

The look of disgust that carried was overwhelming to say the least. That being said, I am an electrician with 25 years of experience in residential, commercial, and industrial. I was considering starting an electrical company that caters directly to the aforementioned community. 
Is it legal to target a specific demographic?
Do you think it would be successful?
Would you hire a company that only worked for the LGBT community?
Have you ever experienced the same "degradation"?

Just wondering if anyone thinks it would soar, or flop.

Thank you for your input, and have a wonderful weekend.

title: MWM seeks female email
text:
Let me start by saying that I'm 43 years old and married with kids. I work in the city, have a long commute and struggle to find time to spend with my family, so that's my priority when I'm home. Having said that, I do find the wake-train-work-kids-sleep-repeat cycle wears on me sometimes and I find myself craving a break from my reality. I'm thinking having an email buddy to share life's ups and downs or just talk about whatever comes up would provide just that sort of mental break from everyday life. I guess I'd just love to find a good friend that's just for me and a place to go to discuss whatever I need or want to with no judgement or pretense. Out of necessity this friendship will be a secret, I wouldn't expect my wife to understand and she would naturally be concerned. 

I'm not quite how to get this started but I'm open to friends any sort, though I think a female most definitely fits best for this pupose. However, age, race, looks, location are of no importance for this purpose. Please just be mature (most of the time, ha!) and able to hold up your end of a grown up conversation.

I think I should probably give you a quick look into my makeup so you can make an educated decision whether to take a leap and send a reply. I've thought some about how to do that but settled on a simple stream of consciousness, forgive me if it seems random and a bit trivial, but it's the best I can do here:

I love to read and my library card is one of my prize possessions
Some of my best childhood memories involve trips to the library with my mom. 
I take my boys to our library frequently and hope they'll have some of those same great memories.
I've grown a little more adventurous with food as I've aged and had a chance to travel. Though I still refuse to eat certain basics that you will find strange. 
My boys are my world and I take very seriously the responsibility of raising them. 
I desperately hope I'll be able to help mold them into responsible, respectful, kind, compassionate yet independent and strong young men. 
My favorite thing is to coach them in their various park district sports. Those practices and games are the most fun I have these days. 
I work in finance and have a somewhat stressful job and long commute. It is rewarding at times but also the source of my biggest regret, the time that it takes me away from home. 
Even though I work in finance, math has always been a weakness. I work hard not to let that show. 
I spend an hour each way on the train and hope you will help me fill that time with some interesting conversation. 
I try to be transparent and do my best not to judge others and I'm almost impossible to offend. 
Im organizationally challenged at times and as a result can seem non responsive or unconcerned with timeliness or deadlines. I'm working on that. Ha! 

That's probably enough for now. If you've managed to get through this entire email and still have some interest, please send a reply!

title: In Desperate need of a KIDNEY donor!!!
text:
Hello friends, 

I have posted my appeal before and here I go again, hoping for a Good Samaritan to save me out there. I am in desperate need of a kidney transplant!!Hmmmm...it is amazing the simple things we take for granted like drinking a glass of water, eating a banana, using the bathroom e.t.c which may be a huge undertaking when one has kidney failure!! Also , the idea of sitting on a dialysis machine for 4 hours /3 times a week come rain or shine is taking its toll on me. To be fair, I need to inform you though that organ donation is no small fit ( as it involves surgery). Before anyone can be allowed to donate has to be in very good healthy both physically and mentally.....and of course in consultation with your family. But these past few months, it seems all I can think about is being with another woman. No one specific -- just anyone different.

I know thoughts of sex with others can't be unusual but I can't help but wonder what's spurring it, if women get these kinds of crazy out-of-nowhere impulses and what they do about them. I won't cheat, but I wish I could stop thinking about it so much. It's also something I feel like I can't talk to my wife about, although we are very open with each other. I feel like it would hurt her and she would assume I'm unhappy, which I'm not. 

Any thoughts or replies would be welcome.

title: I'm really going through it...anyone out there
text: I am going through a very difficult time in my life, things are really bad. It all started with a tragic personal loss, no nobody died....but it was a heartbreaking loss nonetheless. It led to a stretch where I honestly couldn't even get myself out of bed or get myself to do or care about anything at all. That obviously funneled its way down to so many other aspects of my life and they obviously were effected in very negative ways. To put it simply, I lost the love of my life and everything else pretty much went to shit along with it. I don't have the money to go see a therapist or shrink, not that I even think that would help. I'm not in a depression, cause I can still laugh and have a good time, I just dread anytime of day or any single moment where I have the quiet time to think about my circumstances. I know I need to keep myself busy, yet at the same time I can't bring myself to do anything at all, talk about counterproductive right. there is just this overlaying cloud of melancholy that is hovering over me and it sucks and I thought that maybe there is someone out there going through something similar. Maybe we can support each other through it all, I don't know....I don't even know if CL is what it once was, maybe it's nothing but bots and psychos and scammers, but maybe, just maybe there is someone out there that can relate and that wants to meet someone who is going through something similar. If there is, get back too me and we can go from there. If not, well best of luck to all of you and hopefully I figure out what in the world I need to do.

title: I just bought 2 Nats Game tix for 4/2 - Care to join me?
text:
Opening weekend at the stadium! Should be a fun time!

Tickets are on me! My "package" came with 2 burgers and 2 beers and a pair of sunglasses! 
Bring a hat, some sunblock and your witty banter and easy going personality and let's go! 
I am a single white female, college educated, 40, no kids, attractive, employed, fit, fun and a lover of baseball!

I don't know all the stats of all the players, or who wears what brand of sock, but I do understand the sport and I love a day at D.C's own leading LEED stadium! 
I imagine I will receive several responses, so to weed out spam, the guys in jail (YES, convicts have access to the internet! LOL) and the married "but only on paper" guys, the following are my caveats:
You must be a heterosexual male who is in my appropriate dating age range. Say, about 35-47 +/- for good measure. I can't really have a hot 24 year old on my arm. . .. Well, I take that back- I can! And given the right 24 year old hottie, I'd be willing to make an exception ;-) After all, it is just a baseball game! 
You must be really SINGLE (Not "separated", Not "attached", Not "engaged", or otherwise encumbered with a partner. I don't disrespect other women, and I won't be a party to your lies or wishful thinking)
You must be FUN! 
You must have higher than a High School Education. Please do not respond to me if you've never traveled outside of your zip code or if you've never been on a plane. 
You must be not be a jack-ass. My tickets are part of my alumni group, and I can't have a Johnny Knoxville wannabe as my date. If you act like an ass, I will distance myself from you, block your #, and leave with someone else. Simple.

Other than those few things, I don't have a whole lot of requirements. Just be easy going, like baseball and open to meeting new people!
Looking forward to your reply!

title: In search of the elusive soulmate
text:
Well, like most friendship ad posts, I am probably looking for a unicorn, but here goes anyway. One thing I've noticed about deep friendships is that they are usually only likely with peers from similar backgrounds, so I am attempting here to give some idea of who I am -- other than "I like shopping, going to movies, eating out." (I mean, who doesn't?) 

With that said, I am married with grown kids. I sometimes find single women not to be compatible with me. It doesn't mean we can't be, but when someone is fervently looking for someone special, being around someone who is already attached seems to get in the way of their personal happiness. OTOH, if someone is content with their relationship status, we tend to gel as friends. Because of my situation, I have free time during the day, so I am looking for someone who also has that freedom. Like almost everyone, I have an opinion about politics, but I dislike being around people who are on either end of the political spectrum. I enjoy social drinking. I enjoy working out. I'm not interested in being someone's motivation for getting into shape, so please don't befriend me with that in mind. I tend not to get along with passive-aggressive personality types over the long term. They are too emotionally shut down to be real with. I like being active, especially with all the wonderful places/things in DC to see/do. I like occasional random texting with people who have a dry, witty sense of humor. I enjoy cooking my own meals and eating fairly healthy, although I'm not maniacal about it. (That doesn't mean I don't like to eat out sometimes.) 

I don't usually hit it off with super-touchy, easily offended types. Really, I am looking for someone who has some degree of emotional and mental strength without that tough, unyielding edge that often accompanies it, and also someone with a compassionate bent. Not that I have arrived, but these are the qualities that I cultivate in myself. Not being a religious person, I recharge by being in or thinking about nature; that is my sanctuary. If you are that unicorn, maybe we can hang out while searching for that pot of gold at the end of a rainbow. No sexual trolls, please

title: Socially awkward guy, doesn't go out much
text:
I'm Jaye!

First off I am a bipolar (manic-depressive) person under medical supervision who takes his meds. I am extremely self-conscious and awkward in the beginning of knowing someone but as I relax I become a great person with loads to offer. For all intents and purposes, I am pretty average I just don't leave my house much unless I have a particular place and time-specific task to accomplish. I would do more except I feel that there is no purpose for me to go out on my own; I prefer having a friend to make memories with. I would like to meet a friend for lunch, a walk through a museum, a picnic at the fountain on the national mall where you can dip your feet and legs into the water and take silly pictures. My favorite thing to do is play video games on nintendo, super nintendo, nintendo 64, nintendo gamecube, nintendo wii, and nintendo wii u (I own all these consoles); I have also recently gotten into playing games on Steam. I love television shows like Archer, Absolutely Fabulous, Charmed (especially Shannen Doherty ones), Golden Girls, Bob's Burgers, the first several seasons of South Park, Forensic Files, and various animes like Sailor Moon (original and Crystal), Zero no Tsukaima, Jigoku Shoujo, Darker than Black, Shakugan no Shana and Higurashi no Naku Koro ni. I love most Disney Cartoon and Live Action movies, any of the Alien/Prometheus movies, Resident Evil movies, Harry Potter movies, Star Wars Saga, Poltergeist movies, Indiana Jones Saga, Matrix movies, and Trainwreck. 

I would like to share these interests with someone who would be interested in sharing them or discovering new things from each other. I just know myself and I will never get out there on my own and try to meet people. I feel awkward when I do which makes me awkwardly stand out as I converse with others or stand aside sampling the foods by myself feeling even more isolated. I do fine if I am with a buddy, much better than you would think given my previous statement, but I just cannot do these things on my own. I need someone to make me feel safe so I can joke and tell stories and say things like, "No you didn't, HOW?!" so people want to tell more in depth versions of their stories. I have spent years having no friend, acquaintances and long-distance ones sure, but I am so alone here.

I do not want to discredit my husband who I have been together with for almost 14 years (happily and definitely not looking for anything romantic by this ad I'm writing); he saved me from being a destructive version of myself and I owe my life to the love that he has given me. But husband is in another department different from friendships. And he has a very busy life, I am alone a lot and its just wearing on me as I age. I just don't know how to make friends in my condition. Its a miracle that I am with someone who loves me too.

If you want to make an awesome friend that will bring color and laughter into your life, I AM that person, I just need to bloom with the warmth of another friend that is willing to get to know me.

Please, if you can, send me a message on FB at Jaye M O'Maye, I check that more than I do email, but you want to rather email, I apologize in advance if I do not respond quickly. 

Well, I'm casting my line. Here's to hope.

title: Professor-type seeks quiet, intellectual, student-type

You're smarter than the average student. A bookworm, perhaps. Or maybe the science type. You're not unfriendly, but most of the men in your classes seem immature to you. They don't understand your erudite fantasies, and you don't understand their crude failures at flattery.

Instead you focus your daydreams on your professors. In small seminars you keep your chin lowered, blushing quickly if your professor catches you looking at him. But in large lectures you are not so coy. Your deep intelligent eyes follow him the entire time. You laugh at his silly quips when no one else does. You linger after class to clarify a point, waiting until the other students have gone. 

I know who you are because over the past twenty years I've watched your likeness many times from my position at the front of the class. I've stared into her eyes and watched her stare back, unflinching, daring me to make a move. Hoping that I would make a move.

I don't spend personal time with my own students because of the obvious ethical considerations, but you are a stranger and have never been in any of my classes.

I'm in my mid-forties, tall, physically-fit, slender, and healthy. I can be polite, charming, and disarming in public, but I'm also strong, confident, and assertive when it counts. If you'd be interested in exploring a discreet relationship with an intellectual man, if you're willing to make some new secrets, and if the ring on my finger doesn't bother you, then I look forward to receiving your reply.

Please understand, though, that if you are selling anything, including yourself, or if you seek tangible favors beyond mutual companionship and pleasure, you have misunderstood my intent and should direct your search elsewhere.

title: Seeking wounded warriors for friendship
text: "Today's troops, tomorrow's veterans, always heroes." Im looking to meet and become friends with our injured heroes who are currently at Walter Reed NMMC or in the surrounding area. I honor you all for selflessly enlisting to protect our country and putting your life on the line to defend our country's freedom. It's very noble and admirable. You dont have to be single to be friends with me. I just want you to know that you are greatly appreciated, even though our government doesnt, I do. I'm astonded by the lack of appreciation that Americans bestow upon our troops. Although I may not agree with the war at hand, I proudly stand behind you all!! Our troops are the reason that this country will continue to retain our freedom and the chance to see many more tomorrows. Honestly guys, It doesnt bother me if you're missing limbs, are in a wheelchair or are otherwise wounded or even if you suffer from PTSD. I am very understanding and extremely accepting, more than the average person. I am very different from every other female out there. Just give me a chance to prove it to you, I am a great person to have as a friend. You can always count on me if you ever need someone to vent to, a shoulder to cry on or to hang out with if youre lonely or bored. My boyfriend is a war veteran, he was blown up in 2005 and depends on a wheelchair for mobility. Please send a pic and some details about you with your reply, I promise I will reciprocate :) Thank you all for serving, you are greatly appreciated and HONORED. I salute you. I look forward to chatting with you and getting to know you.

title: MC Cnty: Searching 4 unlicensed coach for relationship counseling
text:
I am seeking a counselor/coach type person -- female only -- and almost surely unlicensed, for discussion and dialog about relationships. But I seek a situation where you are comfortable with me being undressed, fully exposed, during our meetings and discussion. That's not allowed for licensed counselors/therapists, but unlicensed persons have more flexibility. I enjoy talking through my life issues with someone creative and empathic, and in particular am seeking relationship counseling. I am not seeking sex. But physical exposure and expression facilitates verbal revealing.

I have posted before, and have found someone very helpful to talk to, whom I do see on occasion. But I could benefit from additional dialog, and I'd prefer someone closer to home, which for me means Montgomery County. I'd prefer a location in or close to Montgomery County -- upper NW DC is okay, as is nearby PG county.

I am a single man, middle-aged. Apart from discussion about relationships and dating, you'll find that in such other conversation as naturally arises, I'm intelligent, curious, well-educated, thoughtful. I can be pretty funny at times. 

I'd prefer contacts from counselors/coaches who are at least 30 or older, though a bit younger are welcome to make contact. But generally, more experience with life and dating, and closer to my experience, is likely to work better. In deep or personal conversations, I'm usually more at ease with white or Asian women (no disrespect to others, it's just my cultural base); but I am open to women of other ethnicities making contact and seeing where the mutual comfort level is. 

If you answer, please tell me about anything that you've done that's even kind of related -- former therapists and graduate students in counseling are encouraged to reply. But really any articulate, insightful, empathic woman may be right -- a businesswoman, an academic, military, also a massage therapist, nurses, female bartenders, or even an escort (but once again I am not seeking sex here, not intercourse or oral or any such thing here) -- someone with experience in listening to people on the job, may be right for this and for me.

Along with exploring relationship issues, this sort of experience is a chance for me to feel acceptance and companionship in the company of a woman. It's necessary that you be comfortable with a naked man, but also with possible arousal. I emphasize that there would be no sex, and that the conversation and dialog and coaching are a very real part of this, and very important to me. 

If interested, write to me and I can tell you more about what I'm seeking. I will offer reasonable hourly remuneration for your counseling, coaching and listening skills, and for the environment of acceptance you create. ($50/hour, possibly more, negotiable.) Please confirm your age and also confirm that you can host. 

If you're comfortable with it, you can provide a rough indication of where you are located. I would hope, if it works out, that this would be a once or twice a month type experience, ongoing for some time. I am really seeking someone in Montgomery County, MD.

I am not seeking a "Domme." A real counselor, even unlicensed, is still someone whom I pay, but who builds a genuine, personal connection, in the sense of really getting to know me and wanting to help me improve my life. If the connection works, a counselor/coach really develops a genuine concern for a client, and can, in a sense, celebrate with the client whatever progress the client makes in improving the quality of his life. I am seeking the kind of human bonding, support and connection that comes from a real counselor. If you are a Domme, either in private life or professionally, you'd probably be comfortable with all this, and I'd welcome hearing from you; but I am not seeking that side of your personality (nor your dungeon space).

Put 'Anna Freud' in the subject line to filter out spam.

title: Mentor needed
text:
In need of some career guidance/friendship/new opportunity and am feeling pretty lost.

Would love to meet up with someone successful who either has a job opportunity or a solid lead/advice on career switches.

Me: 29, gainfully employed in the same career for 8 years currently making $55,000 with very little room for growth (think social work). I want to completely get out of that sector and move into something like corporate training, real estate, medical sales, PR/HR etc, etc. Not interested in a scam, get rich quick scheme, or anything that is 100% commission based.

Skills: I am eager to make a a change, fast learner, great researcher, extremely outgoing and personable, warm, smartish (2 undergrade degrees, no master's yet!), well-read, realistic, hardworking, punctual, organized, and reliable. I am happy talking in front of strangers, can work independently under time sensitive deadlines and pressure, and am anticipatory/problem solver. I'm good with kids and demanding personalities and have patience in spades. I'm high energy and active and would love to travel. I'm well put together, fit, and decently attractive (ugh, I hate that that matters in some fields, but I also said I was realistic). In my free time, I travel, volunteer, hike, do yoga, and cook/bake. I have no criminal record, have never been fired, have a driver's license and a car. 

Bad quality- I haven't made the leap on my own because although my job is dead-end, it's secure and that's important to me. It's just me- no rich parents to fall back on and no real safety net. My family is blue collar and I'm the first one in my family to attend college. 

You: Although I am single, I'm not looking for a romantic or sexual relationship so your marital status and age does not matter. I'm looking for a mentor or friendship with someone who wants to take a chance/give back/believes in karma or helping out someone who has never really had a lucky bone in her body!

Please- no shady business ventures, no escort/massage/web cam offers, and not searching for an internet pen pal. 

Thank you for your serious replies and your time! Looking forward to hearing from you!

title: Seeking cuddles, offering cookies...and expecting zero clicks on this
text:
I realize this endeavor has about as much a chance of success as my getting a job at Hooters (these A-minuses I'm rocking are clearly not going to blow anyone's doors off. . .or anything else, for that matter), but, well, worth a shot, right? I mean, it IS Craigslist. . .there are weirdos on here. Like me.

So, what brings me into this den of interweb weirdos? There's no way to say this without sounding douchey, so I'll just say it douchily (that's a word, right?): I need a cuddle. And I'm married.

Yes, I should theoretically get all the cuddling I need at home. But, sadly, circumstances in life seem to be conspiring against that happening, and it's been a long time (years?) since cuddling for the sake of cuddling happened, without all of the attendant pressures and stresses of life intruding on the moment. And I miss that. I miss what it feels like to just get lost in the moment snuggling with someone, feeling them pressed against you, smelling the scent of their hair, just reveling in being close and connected. 

I know what you're thinking--"Hey, dirty old married guy. . .you really just want skeezy sex, but are trying to disguise it as something innocent." That's what I'd be thinking, too, if I were you. I assure you I'm not, but this is CL, and there are weirdos (like me), so why would you believe me?
Hmm. This may be an insurmountable obstacle. Nonetheless, let's press forward. All of you who are no longer reading might be interested. Or not. Since you're no longer reading.

I'm a 36-year-old white professional with brown hair and blue eyes; 5'9"; 150 pounds; generally pretty good smelling. Pretty good at cuddling (by my own reckoning, at least. . .perhaps that doesn't qualify as a ringing third-party endorsement). And I really want to just get lost, if even for an hour, in being close to someone, snuggling with someone, spooning, holding, etc. Life has been incredibly stressful lately, and that sort of contact sounds so relaxing, so amazingly therapeutic. . .sigh.

I know there are services for this sort of thing, and I've inquired, but haven't had any luck finding anyone who's schedule is compatible or who's close enough to make it work. And, it seems weird to pay for that sort of thing (not that I'm opposed to it), as it feels much better when the other person is just as eager to hold and be held. 

So, what am I looking for? Someone who wants the same thing (I should say a lady who wants the same thing. . .sorry, gents; nothing personal). Someone who's ideally available during the day and can host our snuggling. Someone who has a good sense of humor and will look at this the same way I do: a therapeutic modality that will give us both an escape from the stress of life for a little bit, and a chance connect with someone. 

I realize there's exactly 0 people out there who will fit that description, but there's always hope, right? Let me sweeten the pot: I WILL BRING COOKIES! Or whatever baked good tickles your pickle boat (is that a thing?). How can you say no to THAT? 

We could always meet for coffee or something beforehand, too, just to see if we feel like we want to proceed. Snuggling is intimate, and it might be weird to just show up and say, "Hey, nice to meet you, little spoon! Get over here!"

If that sounds remotely interesting, I'd love to hear from you. . .I shan't hold my breath, though, as I'm not very good at that anyway. ;)

(Oh, and for those wondering...I really just do mean cookies. Apparently, as I've learned somewhat awkwardly, that word can mean something else on CL...)

title: broken heart - for a while
text: I am becoming dangerous for myself - twice since October falling in love for women who turned out to be the opposite of what they seemed in the beginning. When I noticed that the attitude of the latest one - a beautiful lady from Ukraine whom I visited in her country - is wrong and things became tense, I honestly broke with her. But now I wish I have been more sneaky. Because she lives now in my every body cell and I wait for her skype message or email like a hungry dog waiting for food. She is a very special corrupt girl, from Ukrainian mafia circles, not kind at all and not a friend, let alone a life partner. But the sweetness of her touch, her loneliness, her accommodating sexual energy, the sounds and moves of her orgasms, her silver laughter, her occasionally very caring ways, her tears when I was leaving - they still haunt me. I wish I minimized the wrong relationship instead of destroying it. What can I do? Wait it out? Replace with another fire? Meet a real friend who will heal all wounds? We shall see. title: Needle in a Haystack.....
text:
Trying to meet someone on CL has become like finding a needle in a haystack. It shouldn't be so difficult.

I think I have many of the traits that women look for here. I'm honest and sincere; passionate, loving, and caring; kind, friendly, and loyal; independent, intelligent, and attractive; a non-smoker, very light drinker, and D/D free; with a good sense of humor. That all sounds good, right???

However, when I respond to ads, I often get lost in the mass replies that ladies receive. Sometimes, I resend my replies a few days later asking if there is any interest, and I hear that they never saw my first reply.

So many people are scared. Many others are playing games. Add in the lies, deceptions, SPAM, and SCAMs, and it is so hard today to make a connection.....like trying to find a needle in a haystack.

If you are my needle I would love to find you. I want to find a lady that is looking for friendship, someone to do activities with, enjoys the outdoors, likes to cuddle, and would like a little romance when the time is right. Someone that can enjoy the moment, and doesn't have an agenda or is looking for someone to take care of them. Someone that is able to take it as it goes, has faith in us to build a friendship and/or a relationship, without self-imposed pressures.

Tell me a little about yourself so we can get started. Any age, race, religion, personal situation, etc. is welcome to reply. None of it matters to form a friendship, and we'll see where it goes from there. I don't need to see your pic because I care more about who you are rather than what you look like; however, if you want me to send you a pic, I expect you to send me yours first. Please put your favorite dessert in the subject line. If we meet someplace that has it on the menu, I'll buy you a serving of it. Thanks!

Please don't reply if you aren't real or serious, or want to exchange endless emails. I'm very serious about meeting to get to know you in person, and I want nothing to do with joining websites or paying for memberships.

title: Catch 22
text:
This post if for my friend. Yes, I am a match maker like the movie, "Fiddler on the Roof." But, this is about him and not me.

6'2, thin swimmer's build, blond hair, with a very mild mannered look about him. He actually has great endurance too as he rides his bicycle to and from the city for arts and cultural events to include, tech start-ups, art receptions, conventions, ceremonies, independence days, lectures, etc. If it has a good reception, then more than likely he is interested. He also likes to memorize poetry and is able to recite it. He sells used books and frequents estate sales, libraries, and all sorts of places with dust and the smell of old things. You can also find him on Sunday at the flea market in Georgetown selling his jewelry which is another side job of his. He also does a d.j. show playing music of his choosing usually with some quirky poetic messages usually with strong female roles such as Goldfrapp.

I think, but I could have the wrong author, but he likes the Emily Dickinson look. WASPY, nerdish, plain, dry lips, a bit odd, awkward, au naturel in all ways, shy, people are somewhat his type. We recently saw a movie with Anne Heche and he found her short hair and disco dancing hot. 

He is somewhat in a "Catch 22" situation as he never approaches anyone, and the type of person he likes would never approach him. So, he is left memorizing this poetry with no one to recite it to.

title: Solder Art Music Coffee Beer Company
text:
Hi! Thanks for reading my post. I am known around the city by a lot of the museums and galleries. I attend lectures on a regular basis. I usually like the big names and famous people with international recognition. I enjoy lectures on art, physics, poetry and many other subjects. I sometimes talk a little rapidly, but for those with an interest in what I am talking about it usually is well received. For instance, this morning I was having a lovely exchange with a barista putting on a presentation on four types of coffee she was brewing and we discussed different types of beans a and brewing techniques. I also was talking with a lovely architect from Wisconsin and we were toe to toe in discussing the development in Washington, with different architects and developers. Then I briskly hung out at SAAM for some coffee, tea, and to ride their WIFI in the LUCE area of the gallery. Then, I ran to the NGA for a classical mandolin concert with an excellent percussionist, with a dessert of one of the last documentaries of a famous icon in filmography. This is actually being written unbeknownst to me in fictional form by a friend of mine trying to set me up. 

If you like to solder or stand in lines I'd love to buy your old solder gun, or pay you to stand in line for Congressional hearings/ All jokes aside, if you like art and running around the city I am always availed to company.

title: Some CL Thoughts
text:
Here's some helpful tips for all you CL'ers out there:

1. The ratio of real ads posted by men versus real ads posted by women in roughly 100 to 1. In other words men, you have very little chance of getting a response from a woman who has posted an ad on CL.
2. Men should be aware that women typically get 100s of responses to their ads, so if they respond to you, that means they've picked you out of hundreds of men, act accordingly. But it can also mean that they will be corresponding with perhaps dozens of men while they are also chatting with you. Be patient with them.
3. Women should be aware that if you respond to a man's ad, you are likely the only real response he's received from that ad. That means, frankly, that he will focus his efforts on you because you are the only one he is chatting with regarding his ad.
4. Everybody lies and virtually everyone is chatting with more than one person while they are also chatting with you, even if it's people they've met online from years past. It's just human nature.
5. Guys will drive a conversation toward sex 90 percent of the time, sometimes in a subtle way sometimes in a not so subtle manner. Women, if you don't like that sort of banter, explicitly tell the guy you don't want to chat about such things.
6. Inexplicably, men still send their dick pictures to women unsolicited. . . this is the quickest way to end a correspondence with a woman.
7. Women are just as bad as men when it comes to ending correspondence without explanation and for no apparent reason. What's up with that?
8. Guys place ads and respond to ads in every section of CL for the same purpose: S.E.X.
9. Don't become too emotionally invested in someone that you've met online from CL too soon. Why? Because the vast majority of CL connections end after a few days, at best. So why put yourself through the emotional pain?
10. The vast majority of women will never meet a man they are corresponding with on CL, no matter what they say in their ad. And for good reason, they don't really know the guy and frankly, they are more curious than anything else. There's a big difference between chatting and being in the same place at the same time with a man that a woman barely knows.
11. Always be ready for disappointment. All CL relationships eventually end. It's sad, but true.
12. Above all else, have fun and don't take yourself too seriously, leave that task to others ïŠ

Kathy is my little secret that I am keeping from her. I love my girlfriend, but I am cheating on her. She doesn't know Kathy, but Kathy knows her; she walks by her almost everyday.

title: Re: thanks for nothing cl
text:
For the guys asking why I'm giving up on cl.

EVERY guy I've ever had contact with on CL has lied. And not about the "normal" stuff like their age, weight or height.

They have multiple accounts so I get completely different responses from the same guy testing the waters. If I ignore him from one address he sends a new response from a different email trying to bait me into believe he's someone new.

That's not the worst of it. When I find a guy on "strictly platonic" looking to see a movie and then I cross reference him on ALL of CL I find him posting for scat, daddy daughter play, rape fantasies etc....

That's your business guy. No judgement there but I don't want to be alone in a dark theater with you. Don't be mad about it.

And this is not to mention the countless emails I get from spineless anonymous "men" badgering and bullying me. CL is a smaller place than you imagine. I can figure out pretty quickly who the pussy is on the other end of the emails. 

To the one and only nice guy on CL "I'm sorry". To everyone else good day.

title: Model Agent ISO Aspiring Beauty-Fashion Models
text:
Hello: 

I hope you are feeling positive about yourself today, and your sincere interest and ability to be a beauty or fashion model. There are many different types of models and I am only interested in women between the ages of 21 and 30. You should be slender, perhaps voluptuous, with a very pretty face, but not over-weight, but not a skeleton either.

I am a personal agent that works with models. I work with aspiring models that have worked with the "model management" companies who make promises but only want your money for weight-loss / exercise; photos; "training", very expensive modeling conventions that lead to no-where like AMTC; and once your money or parent's funds are exhausted, they blame you for failing, but of course once they no longer receive money from you, they don't want to work with you. This is the same practice in the DC area as well as in NYC regarding "Model Management" companies; that they make a livelihood off of your dreams like a parasite.

So women come to me for help. I only work with someone who is so unique and beautiful that I know that promoting her will be a success. I can show you my business card, web portfolio of my sexy models and that my little agency is listed in Peter Glenn Publications with other modeling agencies.

To be honest with you, beautiful foreign women, Hispanic, and other minorities are in vogue but certainly Barbie types are also welcome.

Every aspiring model at the agency she "works for" (actually pays for) begs them to promote her but as her money runs out she begins to realize they will not promote her unless she already has a proven modeling track record.

I deal with the most unique models that have been unfairly passed over; but only one or two at a time.
Do you know how difficult and time-consuming it is to promote someone? And yes, my method works and it is proprietary.

So what can the woman give me to spend hours and hours and hours.....of hard labor. She has to help me in the laborious process of promoting her to vendors NOT STUPID, WORTHLESS MODELING AGENCIES. Please don't respond if you have never worked for a "Model Management" agency where you have not been used and rejected because you will have an unrealistic view of modeling.

My reward from the women I help is an SD/SB life style on a platonic basis. 

I am not interested in obtaining money from you for my services.

You provide me company on either a Friday or Saturday evening, basically to a nice restaurant which of course I pick up the tab. There we talk like an interview, as well about our personal lives if you feel comfortable, where you explain your experience, sad stories, bring your modeling portfolio and in turn, I give you advice as to your chances...what works and what won't work for vendors who will hire you through me as your agent. Obviously, if we are successful, I as your agent obtain a fee percentage from your modeling work. So if I start promoting you, it means I am seriously interested in you because I believe you have a chance and we sign a contract. If successful, I sign the contract with the vendor. You get paid from me as your agent, as I get paid from the vendor directly. This is how it works with all artists. 

The reason I put the personal listing here is that I am lonesome on the weekends and want some company to dinner with my aspiring model to catch up on how we are progressing in our promotions and personal lives.

Unfortunately, something wonderful was torn from the interwoven fabric of my life and I am lost and broken. 

Btw, we would not be out later than 9 pm to 10pm so you can catch up with your beau or friends to party.

If you are interested in this SD/SB arrangement, you are providing beautiful company for an older gentleman and I am helping you open doors to a possible career, money and fame. I think it is a fair deal. Please don't worry, we will only meet in public places and say our goodbyes in a public place. I encourage you to have your own boy friend as you will need your own support system through this difficult process.

Since this involves legitimate modeling, I need 2 pics: a headshot and a full body shot, height, weight to start with and your experiences in modeling; and your honest interest in voluntarily complying with the particular rules of this SD/SB arrangement.

If I don't respond to you, please do not get mad at me or be angry. This is a very difficult field and the vendors are very persnickety and so must I.

Lastly, if you are the cynical type, please don't respond. I am for real and can work wonders for a few good aspiring models.

I truly wish you all the best. :-)

title: Professor Seeks Bookworm
text:
m4w

It's almost 9pm on a Saturday night and there's nothing to do. Most of the other twenty-somethings and thirty-somethings are going out to the bars and clubs. You could go too; perhaps your friends have invited you to go out with them; but it's really not your thing. What you wish most of all was that the library was open. A really nice library, with cozy chairs, hardwood floors, area rugs, and real wooden bookshelves. But at this time of night, all of the libraries are closed and locked. Apparently nobody likes to read a Saturday night.

Still, you like to fantasize. You like to imagine yourself walking through the aisles, pausing ever so briefly each time one of your familiar favorites catches your eye: Austen, Bronte, Dickens, Dickinson, Faulkner, Hemingway, Hugo, Joyce. . . Just seeing the names brings a smile to your face as you recall the pleasures that their words have given you over the years. You've already read almost everything by the great ones, but there is always something more. Another treat to savor. Those last few Shakespeare plays you've never read. Or one of Vladimir Nabokov's more obscure novels from his Russian period. Or Finnegans Wake. No, not Finnegans Wake. You need something that will satisfy tonight, not next year. How about an Emily Dickinson poem? Yes.

You pull a book off the shelf, open to a random page, and continue slowly walking down the aisle as you read the words

Master--open
your life wide, and
take me in forever,
I will never be tired--
I will never be noisy
when you want to be
still--I will be
your best little
girl--

Suddenly, not looking where you are going, you walk right smack into a man. A tall man in a corduroy blazer and dark rimmed glasses. A man who is probably at least ten years older than you, if not more. A man who is surprisingly fit and attractive in a college professor sort of way. Where did he come from? This is your library. Your dream. Your imagination. You thought you were alone. Embarrassed and flustered, you apologize and quickly turn around to head in the other direction.

"The library is closed. What are you doing here? How did you get in here?" His voice is deep and smooth. Strong. And as he speaks, he places a firm hand on your shoulder.

"What are you reading?" he asks as he steps closer and places his other hand on your other shoulder. You wonder what kind of dream this is. You can feel his eyes as they read the words on the page

nobody else will see me, but you--
but that is enough--
I shall not want any more--

His big hands begin to slide down your arms, and you can feel your breath quickening. You notice a simple gold band on his finger, and your eyes fixate on it as he takes the book from you, closes it, and places it on the shelf.

You turn around to face him, and you raise your head until the two of you are looking directly into each other's eyes. An academic man and a young scholar. A common love for literature. A quiet place to share each other's interests.

Perhaps we should continue the discussion in a real library?

title: ISO Young Woman with an Old Soul
text: I am looking for young woman with an old soul. Someone to talk to who would enjoy the company of an thoughtful but aging man for conversation, people watching, motorcycle rides and fun stuff around the city this spring. But please note, I want to be your friend and companion, I do not want to be your sugar daddy. I do not even want to be your daddy. I have kids that I love and am not looking for another one. I understand that if you are younger you will be less financially ready to go out and spend money, and I don't mind paying for stuff, but there's plenty of stuff that we can do around the city that doesn't really require a lot of money. But I think it's naèª°ve and condescending to think that the only way an older man and a younger woman can spend time together is by falling into either a sugar daddy relationship or a father daughter relationship. It seems sexist and ageist to think that way. I am divorced and I am happy with being single. I just like meeting different people and have dated and friended women from 18 all the way up to their mid 50s. When I was 15, my best friend was a 80 year old lady on my block who smoked Pall Mall unfiltered. I held her arm as we walked around the block so she could get her exercise. There are qualities to appreciate with everyone across the board, so please, no silly hate mail from haters who want to hate. I am very open to whom I meet and have ads that are for women closer to my own age. And I don't care much about your looks. Just be over 18, honest, kind, and sincere. As for me, I am tall, a deep thinker, a working DC professional but also dabble in art and music in my spare time. I like art, music, culture, politics, and like to get crazy just like anyone else. I am very open-minded and hope you are too. If you'd like to meet somewhere and talk about life, please say hi.

title: In search of the elusive soulmate
text:
Well, like most friendship ad posts, I am probably looking for a unicorn, but here goes anyway. One thing I've noticed about deep friendships is that they are usually only likely with peers from similar backgrounds, so I am attempting here to give some idea of who I am -- other than "I like shopping, going to movies, eating out." (I mean, who doesn't?) 

With that said, I am married with grown kids. I sometimes find single women not to be compatible with me. It doesn't mean we can't be, but when someone is fervently looking for someone special, being around someone who is already attached seems to get in the way of their personal happiness. OTOH, if someone is content with their relationship status, we tend to gel as friends. Because of my situation, I have free time during the day, so I am looking for someone who also has that freedom. Like almost everyone, I have an opinion about politics, but I dislike being around people who are on either end of the political spectrum. I enjoy social drinking. I enjoy working out. I'm not interested in being someone's motivation for getting into shape, so please don't befriend me with that in mind. I tend not to get along with passive-aggressive personality types over the long term. They are too emotionally shut down to be real with. I like being active, especially with all the wonderful places/things in DC to see/do. I like occasional random texting with people who have a dry, witty sense of humor. I enjoy cooking my own meals and eating fairly healthy, although I'm not maniacal about it. (That doesn't mean I don't like to eat out sometimes.) 

I don't usually hit it off with super-touchy, easily offended types. Really, I am looking for someone who has some degree of emotional and mental strength without that tough, unyielding edge that often accompanies it, and also someone with a compassionate bent. Not that I have arrived, but these are the qualities that I cultivate in myself. Not being a religious person, I recharge by being in or thinking about nature; that is my sanctuary. If you are that unicorn, maybe we can hang out while searching for that pot of gold at the end of a rainbow. Platonic replies only, please

Hey guys!! Here's the deal. We are a young couple (mid 20's) with a small daughter. My husband is a sicilian chef that has only been here for two year. It's been hard to find friends to connect with. And even harderder to meet people from Sicily. He doesn't know am doing this. I'm just trying something out here. I'm looking for a guy friend mainly for him but cool enough to hang we both of us. If you are a couple even better. We love to go fishing, so I was thinking to arrange like a "hey am from Sicily" kinda run into. Lol we love to cook and entertain. We are fluent in Spanish as well. His a gamer and 420 friendly. We love to chill and listen to music or watch movies. We love the beach, so lots of OC trips this summer. We love beer and good food. On a budget but good ;) any questions? just ask. I'm a professional photographer trying to build my own business. 

I'm not looking for anything sexual, so don't get any ideas. 

Hope to hear from you soon. (sorry I don't speak Italian, but I understand a lot). Thank you

title: Worth a shot, right?
text:
So cards on the table, here is what I'm looking for: someone witty and bitingly sarcastic who knows how to use a semicolon, who shares my cynical world view while also seeing the inherent goodness in humanity. She should be fit and easy on the eyes. I want to chat during the day and share occasional happy hours. And, if it all works out and we connect, I want to head back to your place and go down on you--no reciprocation necessary; I would eagerly engage in post orgasm(s?) cuddling at your discretion. This would, of course, only follow serious chemistry establishment.

Here's the catch: I am tall and fit and attractive. That's not really what one typically means by a "catch," you say? You haven't been on craigslist long, I retort. I'm also witty and charming and respectful of normal social mores. That is to say, I am confident that even if our banter only lasts three emails and you change your mind, you won't be permanently creeped out. Seriously, I am a great guy with a particular need. Stranger things have happened.

I mean, give it a shot. Worst case: you trade a couple of emails and decide I'm an idiot. Best case: you make a new friend who will make you laugh and give you mind blowing orgasms. High upside.

title: cuddle therapy
text:
Hello, my name is Jack, I am a former army medic turned college student. I'm finishing my degree in linguistics at George Masson (i am multilingual, there is a list at the bottom) and on the side I do cuddle therapy. This is non sexual, clothes stay on and there is no contact other than what you request, weather a simple hug or a massage, or maybe you just need some one to listen to you as an objective third party. There is no wrong way to go about it, sit and talk or relax on a couch and read a book. Whatever helps you to unwind. 

As this is a relatively new and, I find, misunderstood form of therapy, I am professional and discreet. I won't ask for personal details or information. And I work only for tips. So it's up to you what it's worth.

Cuddle therapy is as relaxing for me as it is for my clients, there is no thrill factor, just a brief connection between friends to remind us that the world can be a gentle place. 

I look forward to talking to you and answering any questions. Good day to you and best wishes.

title: Want to go to Taste of the South (TOTS)?
text:
So here's the deal. I bought tickets to Taste of the South for myself and the ex, but now that I have reverted to singleness these tickets are in need of a good home. I suppose I could sell them, but last year's event was so delicious and fun, why not take this opportunity to meet new people and go again?

That's where you come in. Instead of asking out one of the women I know tangentially who will think I'm trying to date her seriously, I think making a new friend would be fun. The worst case is we get dressed up and eat lots of BBQ and fried chicken, so really this plan can't go wrong.

More about me:
- From south of the Mason-Dixon line, so I count as a Southerner. Unfortunately I don't have the accent, but I do have the manners.
- My friends think I'm funny - in a good way. You might as well.
- I have a job that I like. I think it's a pretty good one, even for success-obsessed DC. Try saying "success obsessed" really fast five or six times in a row. 
- I am not homicidal and I hope you aren't either.
- And I'm sure you care about stats: I'm younger than 32, taller than 5'10," and women who are not my mother have said I'm cute. 
- I can't believe I'm looking for a date on craigslist. But then you probably can't believe you are either, so your secret is safe with me.

More about you:
- You heard about how great TOTS is, or went last year, and want to go.
- You're a Southern belle. Or at least able to fake it for a few hours while eating wonderful Southern food, drinking Cheerwine, and dancing.
- You like dressing up. Southerners don't mess around with sartorial adventures - this thing is formal after all.

So send me a message and tell me more about you: what's your name, what's your story, and what's your favorite joke? Bonus points if you include a picture wearing seersucker, hats, and/or pearls - or something adequately Southern to support your bona fides. I'm willing to respond in kind - and if you want to make sure I don't have two heads I'd be ok with connecting on facebook or meeting up in person ahead of time. 

Cheers!

title: Stipend for female athlete as exercise/ accountability buddy
text:
Maybe this is a weird thing to look for but I'm hoping to find someone that would be interested in being a pseudo personal trainer - you'd workout with me some (and pick the workout) and other times assign me workouts and fitness related activities. You'll discourage me from slacking or procrastinating on workouts by assigning extra if I do or figuring out other consequences if I do. 

You: Female (I find I work better with female trainers and I also find women tend to be better at creating structure), very physically fit and athletic yourself (maybe you played a varsity sport, maybe you are into crossfit or triathlons or just generally being a badass). You have some interest in fitness, health and diet and enjoy pushing someone. 

Me: healthy, hwp, fit 30 year old man looking to take it to a whole new level. I currently workout about 3-4 times a week but have mediocre eating habits and lack consistency on both exercise and diet. 

If you are into fitness and like the idea of training someone and getting paid while you workout, you should write me. I'm a member at Vida and have access to all locations or I'm open to working out somewhere else if you have a strong preference for that.

title: Online Romance eMail Love Affair
text:
Maybe we are both looking for something to make us feel a little more alive in life? I am looking for something to spark up what has become a non-eventful unexciting life. I am married, but I feel invisible most of the time, the electric sensations of love and sexual intimacy gone. I want to flirt with and exchange hot emails and feel that hot sexual passion again with someone. I am not looking to ever met physically, this is all online and emotionally. . .a fun and playful love affair in our minds. I won't hound you for pictures or phone calls or texts, just all via email.

What I am seeking is an online relationship where we are the naughty secret of each other. I seek a fantasy lover I can flirt with, share intimate secrets with (no matter how bizarre or forbidden or sexual they may be). Someone to make me feel desired again, and someone I can give those same feelings to. Someone that will get tingly feelings and a racing heart when you see you have an email from me. Someone to share our wildest fantasies with, our desires and dreams. I am also open to talking about other things too, anything you want to. Or use me as a shoulder to cry on or bounce ideas off of. I will gladly discuss the good and the bad with you, or most anything. I am open to anything that you want.

I hope I don't sound too weird and this is what you have in mind as well. I'm really pretty normal, slightly crazy but normal with a quirky sense of humor and a libido that has run amuck with raging 'unused' hormones. I want us sharing our experiences and fantasies, I want to arouse you and excite you and make you feel wanted ...craved ,actually by a man. I want you to grow wet thinking about me, the way I grow hard thinking of you. Interested? Tell me more about you. . .describe yourself so I can picture you perfectly in my fantasies about us. ~smile~ Ask me anything and I promise you truthful answers.

I am college educated, fairy successful, funny (quirky, lol), oh yes, and horny, lol. Im open and non-judgmental, your secrets and passions are safe with me sweet girl. Love to know more about you.

title: Soccer Mom
text:
After reading through a number of postings on CL in the strictly platonic section, I decided to try posting myself seeking a woman with a similar paradigm since no post I read seems to have what I seek. Let me start off by stating that this is a real post and I am not seeking random sex, a quick hook up and I am not a picture collector. I seek a sincere amazing mental connection and friendship to start. Ideally you are a woman who is smart, can laugh at herself, good conversationalist, honest, happy but seeking to enhance our life with a new friend, family-oriented and a bit playful (this does not mean crude talk). I believe I have those qualities that I seek in addition to being active/athletic, successful, handsome and playful. I am a white male who is seeking a white female who is looking for a new connection. I enjoy cooking, good movies, reading, antique shops, the beach, working out/cross fit training, great conversation and much more. I would love to learn more about your interests and I have an inquisitive mind so I hope you don't mind questions. We all live in our daily circles and have busy lives with friends and family so meeting new quality people can, at times, be a challenge. By posting here, I thought it might result in expanding my daily interactions and possibly resulting in a good friend who enjoys similar activities and conversation.

This is a new endeavor for me so I would hope we could email first and learn about one another. No rush for anything, just a good friendship to start and see how things organically proceed. If you are intrigued enough to respond to this post, please type in your age in the subject line so I know you are real. Age range is 30-50. I am hopeful there is someone reading this as sincere as I am who is not looking to play games or engage in random acts of nonsense.

title: I want to try a social experiment this weekend

Clearly things like SSN or ATM PIN are off the table, but it would be fascinating to both talk to someone with all filters off. It would also be kind if intriguing for me to make myself transparent like this. We can give ourselves timeouts so we aren't overwhelmed. The goal of this is to learn and have fun, not freak each other out. Please say a little about yourself in your reply. I'm an older divorced profesional guy, super friendly, well-read and well travelled, liberal, clean healthy educated into music, art, science, history, culture, busy high stress white collar job, decent social life but sometimes it just feels all starts to feel boring af and I get ideas like this to stretch my brain and expand how I see other people and process the world around me. title: Professor-type seeks quiet, intellectual, student-type
text:
You're smarter than the average student. A bookworm, perhaps. Or maybe the science type. You're not unfriendly, but most of the men in your classes seem immature to you. They don't understand your erudite fantasies, and you don't understand their crude failures at flattery.

Instead you focus your daydreams on your professors. In small seminars you keep your chin lowered, blushing quickly if your professor catches you looking at him. But in large lectures you are not so coy. Your deep intelligent eyes follow him the entire time. You laugh at his silly quips when no one else does. You linger after class to clarify a point, waiting until the other students have gone. 

I know who you are because over the past twenty years I've watched your likeness many times from my position at the front of the class. I've stared into her eyes and watched her stare back, unflinching, daring me to make a move. Hoping that I would make a move.

I don't spend personal time with my own students because of the obvious ethical considerations, but you are a stranger and have never been in any of my classes.

I'm in my mid-forties, tall, physically-fit, slender, and healthy. I can be polite, charming, and disarming in public, but I'm also strong, confident, and assertive when it counts. If you'd be interested in exploring a discreet relationship with an intellectual man, if you're willing to make some new secrets, and if the ring on my finger doesn't bother you, then I look forward to receiving your reply.

Please understand, though, that if you are selling anything, including yourself, or if you seek tangible favors beyond mutual companionship and pleasure, you have misunderstood my intent and should direct your search elsewhere.

title: Random Chance Meeting...
text:
Do you ever find yourself in place where maybe just visiting with a total stranger feels like the right thing? Even though you may be surrounded by people that care about you, there's just that yearning to talk to a total stranger?

Have you ever thought about those random chance moments when you're walking down the street and you smile at someone, just because. . ... and then later you say to yourself, I wonder what kind of an icebreaking conversation might have cropped up if we were stuck on the street corner for 5 minutes.

Do you ever go home after a long hard day at work and find yourself having the same conversations with the same people over and over again? You know. . ..."How was your day?" "Fine, and yours?" "Fine". . ... "Oh that's nice. . ..did you hear that such and such happened to so and so?" "No, that's too bad."

I think you get the idea. 

About me:
I'm an early 50's caucasian professional guy visiting from out of state for a couple more days. At 6' 00", 200 lbs., I am clean, well groomed, respectful, and enjoy great company. I'm not at all judgmental and would expect the same in return. I am successful in many ways and yet still feel a void.

About you:
My ideal companion would be able to carry on great conversation, have a wonderful sense of humor, simple but elegant. A lady that knows how to dress up but is also comfortable in a nice pair of jeans and a plain top. . .and also a girl that prefers the latter of the two! 

So maybe consider this a jump start to a possible "not so random chance meeting." Maybe a nice dinner, a cocktail, and some great conversation with a total stranger. My treat of course.

Shoot me an email. Let's get acquainted just a bit and see where it goes!

Mike.

title: Seeking cuddles, offering cookies...and expecting zero clicks on this
text:
I realize this endeavor has about as much a chance of success as my getting a job at Hooters (these A-minuses I'm rocking are clearly not going to blow anyone's doors off. . .or anything else, for that matter), but, well, worth a shot, right? I mean, it IS Craigslist. . .there are weirdos on here. Like me.

So, what brings me into this den of interweb weirdos? There's no way to say this without sounding douchey, so I'll just say it douchily (that's a word, right?): I need a cuddle. And I'm married.

Yes, I should theoretically get all the cuddling I need at home. But, sadly, circumstances in life seem to be conspiring against that happening, and it's been a long time (years?) since cuddling for the sake of cuddling happened, without all of the attendant pressures and stresses of life intruding on the moment. And I miss that. I miss what it feels like to just get lost in the moment snuggling with someone, feeling them pressed against you, smelling the scent of their hair, just reveling in being close and connected. 

I know what you're thinking--"Hey, dirty old married guy. . .you really just want skeezy sex, but are trying to disguise it as something innocent." That's what I'd be thinking, too, if I were you. I assure you I'm not, but this is CL, and there are weirdos (like me), so why would you believe me?
Hmm. This may be an insurmountable obstacle. Nonetheless, let's press forward. All of you who are no longer reading might be interested. Or not. Since you're no longer reading.

I'm a 36-year-old white professional with brown hair and blue eyes; 5'9"; 150 pounds; generally pretty good smelling. Pretty good at cuddling (by my own reckoning, at least. . .perhaps that doesn't qualify as a ringing third-party endorsement). And I really want to just get lost, if even for an hour, in being close to someone, snuggling with someone, spooning, holding, etc. Life has been incredibly stressful lately, and that sort of contact sounds so relaxing, so amazingly therapeutic. . .sigh.

I know there are services for this sort of thing, and I've inquired, but haven't had any luck finding anyone who's schedule is compatible or who's close enough to make it work. And, it seems weird to pay for that sort of thing (not that I'm opposed to it), as it feels much better when the other person is just as eager to hold and be held. 

So, what am I looking for? Someone who wants the same thing (I should say a lady who wants the same thing. . .sorry, gents; nothing personal). Someone who's ideally available during the day and can host our snuggling. Someone who has a good sense of humor and will look at this the same way I do: a therapeutic modality that will give us both an escape from the stress of life for a little bit, and a chance connect with someone. 

I realize there's exactly 0 people out there who will fit that description, but there's always hope, right? Let me sweeten the pot: I WILL BRING COOKIES! Or whatever baked good tickles your pickle boat (is that a thing?). How can you say no to THAT? 

We could always meet for coffee or something beforehand, too, just to see if we feel like we want to proceed. Snuggling is intimate, and it might be weird to just show up and say, "Hey, nice to meet you, little spoon! Get over here!"

If that sounds remotely interesting, I'd love to hear from you. . .I shan't hold my breath, though, as I'm not very good at that anyway. ;)

(Oh, and for those wondering...I really just do mean cookies. Apparently, as I've learned somewhat awkwardly, that word can mean something else on CL...)

title: Be Honest!!!!
text:
Do you suffer from Intimacy Disorder???????

An intimacy disorder is the inability to find, tolerate, or stay in relationships that involve the risks that come with being fully known. Having such problems denies our most basic human need to deeply bond with others. Humans are meant to be social. From the very first moment we're paired with mom, and throughout our life span we seek various pairings or social groups to fit in or belong--it's an essential part of being alive. Even from the beginning, to achieve health, children need connection, not only for nourishment and protection, but so they know what it's like to have intense engagement with an interested person. It's part of the human condition to enter into deep social and intimate relationships; we are not meant to be isolated creatures, and those of us who spend a lot of time alone tend to be the most troubled people in our culture. The challenge for most of the people is that while these men are quite intellectually intact or even very gifted, and some of them even able to build a strong career and are interesting, engaging people, they are unable to choose, grow, and maintain healthy relationships, especially intimate ones. This is a major problem because we all need healthy relationships for our survival--it is that important. We do not do well alone.

Have an extra room in your house/condo/apartment and you're lonely or busy? Looking for friendship or companionship, but not necessarily a relationship?

You: 28-40, male, have a professional career and an extra bedroom in your place in NOVA/DC. Bonus points if you're within walking distance to a metro and you have a dog. No drugs or criminal record.

Me: 30, female, have a professional career and am trying to save money to purchase my own place within the year. Love living near the city but hate the rent, so looking for an alternative arrangement. I can offer cooking/baking, I'll keep the place clean (I'm not a neat freak though), and hanging out occasionally- movies, sports, breweries, etc. I also workout daily, so if you need someone to go to the gym with you and keep you motivated, I'm the right person! I eat and cook pretty healthy during the week, indulgent on the weekends and am happy to share whatever I cook. I have roommate references, a clean record, and excellent credit history. I travel about one weekend a month and spend my free time volunteering, exploring the city, brunching and happy hours, and watching sports. 

Think of me as a new buddy who will cook for you or go to the gym with you and help keep your place clean. Don't think of me as an escort or girlfriend. Although I am single, I don't want to live in a place where things are expected of me that I'm not comfortable with. You'll save money on groceries and probably end up healthier than before you first met me. :)

Move in date: May 31/June 1. Looking for at least through the summer (until end of September), but longer if we hit it off. 

Serious replies only! Thank you so much!

title: I read the most interesting book
text: I defiantly have to share this with my book club. ESCAPE FROM MARCY, by author Leon Thomas, changed the way I see people and things; it made me look inward. When you are living in poverty, and your back is up against the wall, and there is no hope left to borrow from, and there is no escape out of hell that you find yourself in, and there is an abyss staring back at you, and the thought of suicide hits you like a cold wind...what do you do? There is a man wearing a gray hoodie, and a fresh pair of Jordans; and he is standing at the corner of Marcy Avenue & Flushing; he lives at the Marcy Projects in Brooklyn. He has something that will take the pain away and make you escape reality. He is the gatekeeper between heaven and hell; in his pockets are the keys. He is a necessary evil; a savior. He won't stare at the bruises on your knees and ask how you got the money to pay him. He never looks you in the eye. Wow! The book kind of gave me a nostalgic feeling I can not describe. It made me escape. I was able to download a picture of the cover.

title: The story of MY RELATIONSHIP!
text:
The lack of compromise will ruin any relationship! Believe me I know. It's a pain in the ass when you're in a relationship with someone and the only compromise they make is barely cooking dinner. Imagine going out of your way to please someone and when it comes to them reciprocating the favor it's like pulling teeth.

A relationship should not be this stressful. Yeah, people fight and people argue but simple compromises like let's go out to eat, let's go and watch a movie, etc shouldn't even be an issue, especially when you're the one paying to do these things. Imagine when it's her turn to want to go out and you say YES to everything knowing inside that you don't have any desire to do so?

title: In search of the elusive soulmate
text:
Well, like most friendship ad posts, I am probably looking for a unicorn, but here goes anyway. One thing I've noticed about deep friendships is that they are usually only likely with peers from similar backgrounds, so I am attempting here to give some idea of who I am -- other than "I like shopping, going to movies, eating out." (I mean, who doesn't?) 

With that said, I am married with grown kids. I sometimes find single women not to be compatible with me. It doesn't mean we can't be, but when someone is fervently looking for someone special, being around someone who is already attached seems to get in the way of their personal happiness. OTOH, if someone is content with their relationship status, we tend to gel as friends. Because of my situation, I have free time during the day, so I am looking for someone who also has that freedom. Like almost everyone, I have an opinion about politics, but I dislike being around people who are on either end of the political spectrum. I enjoy social drinking. I enjoy working out. I'm not interested in being someone's motivation for getting into shape, so please don't befriend me with that in mind. I tend not to get along with passive-aggressive personality types over the long term. They are too emotionally shut down to be real with. I like being active, especially with all the wonderful places/things in DC to see/do. I like occasional random texting with people who have a dry, witty sense of humor. I enjoy cooking my own meals and eating fairly healthy, although I'm not maniacal about it. (That doesn't mean I don't like to eat out sometimes.) 

I don't usually hit it off with super-touchy, easily offended types. Really, I am looking for someone who has some degree of emotional and mental strength without that tough, unyielding edge that often accompanies it, and also someone with a compassionate bent. Not that I have arrived, but these are the qualities that I cultivate in myself. Not being a religious person, I recharge by being in or thinking about nature; that is my sanctuary. If you are that unicorn, maybe we can hang out while searching for that pot of gold at the end of a rainbow. Platonic replies only, please

title: Professor-type seeks quiet, intellectual, student-type
text:
You're smarter than the average student. A bookworm, perhaps. Or maybe the science type. You're not unfriendly, but most of the men in your classes seem immature to you. They don't understand your erudite fantasies, and you don't understand their crude failures at flattery.

Instead you focus your daydreams on your professors. In small seminars you keep your chin lowered, blushing quickly if your professor catches you looking at him. But in large lectures you are not so coy. Your deep intelligent eyes follow him the entire time. You laugh at his silly quips when no one else does. You linger after class to clarify a point, waiting until the other students have gone. 

I know who you are because over the past twenty years I've watched your likeness many times from my position at the front of the class. I've stared into her eyes and watched her stare back, unflinching, daring me to make a move. Hoping that I would make a move.

I don't spend personal time with my own students because of the obvious ethical considerations, but you are a stranger and have never been in any of my classes.

I'm in my mid-forties, tall, physically-fit, slender, and healthy. I can be polite, charming, and disarming in public, but I'm also strong, confident, and assertive when it counts. If you'd be interested in exploring a discreet relationship with an intellectual man, if you're willing to make some new secrets, and if the ring on my finger doesn't bother you, then I look forward to receiving your reply.

Please understand, though, that if you are selling anything, including yourself, or if you seek tangible favors beyond mutual companionship and pleasure, you have misunderstood my intent and should direct your search elsewhere.
