title: Edward Rochester seeks Jane Eyre
text:
Jane was young, and she described herself as "obscure, plain, and little". But she was smart, observant, and, despite her innocence, wise beyond her years. Edward was older, tall, quiet, and brooding, with a dark aura about him. He had a few secrets in his attic. And he found conventional society-girls to be boring, vacuous, and incapable of holding his attention.

Edward and Jane were kindred spirits. They were, in fact, the perfect match. Nonetheless, in an era of imposing societal scrutiny, they would never have been able to keep the details of their friendship under wraps. But you and I do not live in nineteenth century England. With some modest discretion, a modern-day Jane and Edward can easily find ways to quietly enjoy the pleasure of each other's company without attracting the attention of the rest of the world.

Be different. Be smart. Be enigmatic. I'll be the same.

title: what if I told you
text:
What if I told you I once had a friend, what if I told you my heart she did rend?

Many were the years and times that we shared,
fighting each day to show that we cared.
But as time grew older and when the moon did not shine bright, we slowly but surely got scared.

Our rhymes and our rythym they painted the way, our sleek silouttes waltzing on easle just could not say;
The light we did shine, the closeness we shared. 
So many emotions all mixed in a room full of chairs.

Our night was so beautiful the feelings so real. The moment it hit me I could do nothing but kneel.
The happiness in our eyes they welled into tears, 
even with all that before us it could not silence our fears.

You were so different so strange and so new,
I did not know how to read 
you and to myself remain true.
Your outbreaks they scared me the wild in your eyes, your silence it scarred me so deep and so blue.

I tried my best to keep you 
You were all that I wanted 
But to need you would ruin us it was you in the end that I hunted.
I chased you through dark and terrible storms, 
through great mountains and valleys I chased you through thorns.

The faster I ran the further you got.
I left all that mattered most to me in the dusk, with reckless abandon I chase you till dawn.

In the end I did find you, afraid and alone. 
So fickle and fragile yet hard as a stone.
After all the years that I chased you, 
I still had no clue who you were.

I gave you my everything, my blood and my tears.
You left me empty and bleeding with no one to hold. 
I broke my life on you of that you may boast.
Left all of my friends for you, 
in time even the one I cherished most.

All of this didn't matter to you, not one single bit.
All you wanted was attention for something not real. 
Like with withdraw from a high the pain so sureal, 
I left you behind me and carved out your stone.
In a dark shallow hole I laid you to rest, I wished you farewell and gave you my best.

So much time has past since that day,
so many changes in the way that I think. 
I'm so sorry for the things that I've said
The blame I pushed on you 
So clear in my head.
It was never your fault,
it was my own heart that would run instead.


I've healed from those days,
Moved on from my past. 
When my head became clear and my heart had recovered,
I daughter to repay you for all the pain that you suffered.
I vowed to protect the memory of you; if I could not have you I know what I'd do. 
I'd give myself up each and every day, 
and fight all your battles so you would not have to.
In time it might make the ruin I caused okay.

I've since moved on from the place that you lay,
But I find my self missing you in every last way.
I have so many friends now,
And a place I call home.
I'm ready to find you in all your usual places I roam.

My heart has grown so big from all the things that you taught me.
I so badly want to share them in ways you could see.

What if I told you I know you by name?
What if I told you I don't play no more games?
What if I told you I once had a friend?
What if I told you I know her by name?
What if I told you some call her sorrow or pain?
What if I told you she is as beautiful as rain?
Wild as the mountains and deep as the sea?
Faithful as always and free as can be?

title: CL Thoughts...
text:
Here's some helpful tips for all you CL'ers out there:

1. The ratio of real ads posted by men versus real ads posted by women in roughly 100 to 1. In other words men, you have very little chance of getting a response from a woman who has posted an ad on CL.
2. Men should be aware that women typically get 100s of responses to their ads, so if they respond to you, that means they've picked you out of hundreds of men, act accordingly. But it can also mean that they will be corresponding with perhaps dozens of men while they are also chatting with you. Be patient with them.
3. Women should be aware that if you respond to a man's ad, you are likely the only real response he's received from that ad. That means, frankly, that he will focus his efforts on you because you are the only one he is chatting with regarding his ad.
4. Everybody lies and virtually everyone is chatting with more than one person while they are also chatting with you, even if it's people they've met online from years past. It's just human nature.
5. Guys will drive a conversation toward sex 90 percent of the time, sometimes in a subtle way sometimes in a not so subtle manner. Women, if you don't like that sort of banter, explicitly tell the guy you don't want to chat about such things.
6. Inexplicably, men still send their dick pictures to women unsolicited. . . this is the quickest way to end a correspondence with a woman.
7. Women are just as bad as men when it comes to ending correspondence without explanation and for no apparent reason. What's up with that?
8. Guys place ads and respond to ads in every section of CL for the same purpose: S.E.X.
9. Don't become too emotionally invested in someone that you've met online from CL too soon. Why? Because the vast majority of CL connections end after a few days, at best. So why put yourself through the emotional pain?
10. The vast majority of women will never meet a man they are corresponding with on CL, no matter what they say in their ad. And for good reason, they don't really know the guy and frankly, they are more curious than anything else. There's a big difference between chatting and being in the same place at the same time with a man that a woman barely knows.
11. Always be ready for disappointment. All CL relationships eventually end. It's sad, but true.
12. Above all else, have fun and don't take yourself too seriously, leave that task to others

title: I am looking for a Real Friend
text:
Hello craigslist, I'm 37-year-old guy that is fairly new in the area and would like to find a friend or two who shares similar likes and interests. I'm not a very "social person" meaning only that I don't frequent clubs, bars and things of that nature. I am a natural extrovert and in the right crowd or social setting, I am the life and bring a welcomed flavor to any gathering. I figured I would try to see if I could find a friend here without having to jump out into the social scene. I have been sort of a hermit these past months focusing on me and other things. So......

A little about me: I am a full-time grad student who recently retired from the military. I own a German car who has been better to me than any female relationship to date. Her name is Black Beauty. Yes, I know naming your car may be played out but I love her and it's my thing so don't judge me (LOL). For fun I like to drive her around town listening to R&B, Jazz, Rock and hip hop,..... but primarily R&b. When I am not in class, running errands or shopping,...... I love to stay at home and watch Netflix or one of the many peripherals I have to access movies or TV shows. I enjoy searching the Internet, checking out YouTube and collecting electronic gadgets,...(I am an 'Apple' Freak!) I play XboxOne when I am not in the books studying and I like to shoot Air Riffles to relieve stress. What else?..... Oh, I have a dog who is the sweetest doll and like Black Beauty, has always been there for me. I am African American, I believe in God although I don't go to church, I am well traveled, been to over 40 countries, have lived overseas for 12 years, I am divorced with two girls and I can't have anymore children (I made sure of that), I don't drink anymore or "want to do drugs" anymore, but it's ok if you do. I just don't want to have a 'crackhead' buddy or having to chill with you with a needle in your arm if you know what I mean. 420 is tolerable as I used to smoke not to long ago but choose to stop as it was effecting my school work. I am a joker/funny guy and always try to keep humor in and around me. I don't take anything to seriously and absolutely hate drama. I only want honest people around me at this stage in my life. You don't have to lie and pretend to be something you are not, for a change I would like to meet someone who is just normal, who just wants a good trustworthy, dependable, friend. Someone I can have an intelligent conversation or even a healthy debate with without him or her catching feelings or being immature about it and actually have something to say to bring to the table. 

I have dreams/plans of finishing my masters degree in the next year and a half and possibly moving out west somewhere where I can have some land and a bit of isolation. I love people but hate society which is the reason I don't put myself out there by going to clubs and bars like I did in the past. In addition, I have PTSD from my experiences in the military so limiting the time I spend around strangers and the outside world has been helpful in helping me find myself again and avoid drama. Don't worry, I am not a crazy loony tune or something,... I mostly just have issues with sleeping (I'm a night owl) and the occasional panic attacks, depression and hyper vigilance. I tend to be ok in College and in public but like I said, I avoid unnecessary human stimuli unless I need to because there is less to worry about. 

Wow,... I think I will stop sharing for now. If you have gotten this far, you have a pretty good jest of who I am, what I am about and what I am looking for...... just a friend to chill with, to talk to, and develop a lasting friendship I have been without for quite some time. I am not a sex crazed pervert looking for sex, so please don't come at me thinking that is what I am about. I am looking for either male or female, it doesn't matter if you are white or black, Christian or Jew, college educated or High school graduate (please at least have finished High School...LOL), just please be of a mature enough age. I can't imagine chilling with an 18 year old or worse a minor that does not have enough life experience or maturity to hang with me. However, just because I am 37 does not mean I don't get down like I am in my twenties!! Oh,... I would prefer someone who has their life together in the sense that they have a job, own place, transportation and most importantly live near Alexandria/Arlington/Shirlington or surrounding area and have time to chill often. 

Ok, I think that is it. If you think we could be good friends and spend some time getting to know each other,.......... Do this:

Reply back to me with your age / sex / location / profession / make&model of your car (not that it makes a difference, just to make sure you have transportation and to make sure you are real enough to follow simple instructions,.... I have to try to weed out these fake asshole out here), create a funny fake name I can call you until we meet (I don't expect you to hand me any personal information even your name but I would like to refer to you by a name until we establish familiarity and meet if will click),... and write a few sentences about yourself, hobbies, history or anything you feel comfortable sharing. You don't have share as much as I did but please share enough for me to get an idea of who my new potential friend is like.....(hint: a "few" in my eyes is more than 6 sentences). I figure if you can invest the time to write a fraction of what I shared and follow these instructions, ....... I won't have to worry about you being a "Fake" and yes I will discard any replies that looks or resembles anything like a Fake or someone playing games. I put forth the effort as to not waste your time and to be as forthcoming as I could without giving out my SSN,...... so please don't try to waste my time either and reciprocate if truly interested. Last instruction,.... please change the Subject line to ....."I would love to be your New Friend".

I hope I am lucky enough to find someone cool, real, non-judgement and as down to earth as I am,...... I look forward to hearing from you. 

PS,..... I'm have been sitting in my car for the past 30 minutes composing this,..... As you can see in the pictureðŸ˜‹

how real is that?! LOL

title: Surely everyone has the right to fall in love?
text:
Unique, creative, funny guy, relocating to D.C., with a not-so-unique (I hope) philosophy: that everyone has the right to try and find (or fall in) love. 

So for every gay male who shuns another because they are "too tall", "too fat", "too old", "too fem", " too dark" - or anything else on your To-Do list ... good for you for knowing what and who you want, only please also know it doesn't mean that anyone who does fit the above list isn't just as equally deserving of finding their mate (if such a thing exists; reformed romantics like me often wonder).

That said, I am definitely a "chub" I guess you could say - a writer, former actor and comic, and someone who has been over-the-top fortunate to have been in love twice; I think if you find it ONCE in your life, you're lucky. It's been years since I've dated, or wanted to, because of work and moving around and just keeping Cupid at bay because I wanted to be a good ME first - but now those feelings are returning, the memories of waking up cuddling next to someone too good, and though I am finally doing this kind of ad again, I am thinking out of the box with it at the same time, in even bothering to post this.

As I said, EVERYONE deserves to love, and be loved.

I am a gay white male, 53 but supposedly looks about eight or ten years younger (depending on if my goatee is growing in), and definitely considered a chub (though working on it - 33 pounds and counting), so guess that means I am seeking a "chaser". As I said, I am writer but I also have a "regular" job, and also have possibly the most sarcastic sense of humor you may encounter ... but at least you'll never be bored. I love anything creative, books and theater and music and even better-quality television ... but MOVIES are what rock my world the most; am a film buff, with eclectic tastes that raises most people's eyebrows when I discuss some of my favorites.

I tend to be attracted to men with dark hair and eyes, but honestly age, race, none of that matters to me. I am ultimately, I guess, a bottom; I guess I should mention that now, just in case that clouds your answering (and no, I do NOT care about your dick size - what's between your heart means infinitely more to me than what's between your legs), but though I have a fairly high sex drive, I really, truly am so much more about canoodling on the sofa and watching an old movie ... spooning in bed ... cooking a meal together ... just spending time with the guy who makes my chest thump every damn time he's in the room.

But either way, good luck in what you seek - and damn, if you've made it this far, sorry so long and thanks for reading! 

And for friends or dating, I would very much appreciate either as I am new to the area ... in fact, actually, may be even better (and I don't mean sex friends, I mean FRIENDS, I don't have sex with my friends); friends tend to be around long after the latest date/partner/boyfriend has long gone. :0)

title: Chasing the dream (worth reading)
text: First and foremost I would like to thank you for taking the time out to read my ad to in it's entirety. As much as one would dislike writing their bio, it seem necessary in a forum that I would have never fathomed of being in. So with that said I will look to sway your mind and present myself in the manner in which I look to be seen. I guess the coming snow has brought me Craigslist, as well as the mundane schedule in which I have become accustom to. I would like to describe myself as a needle in a hay stack. See I may be what you have always been looking for, but never could find. Although I have been found before, like many thing unfamiliar some past it by no knowing it's true wealth. I have learned a deluge of lessons in my short time, but none more intriguing as this "As we grow older and gain a wisdom we tend to learn that even the one person that you believed would never let you down probably will. You will have your heart broken more than once and its harder every time." I have come to a point in my life where I would like a wonderful women to grow old with. A women that strives for success, and doesn't want a man for the fact that she needs one. She wants a man to share and rejoice with in her happiness and sadness. See I have some to find that this supposed to be the actual reason for dating to find the right one for marriage, but these days both men and women have other motives be it money, sex, or any material item. I sometimes wonder does the word Love still mean what it use to. The word is now used to loosely I feel that at times it has the same value as saying "the". It began as a theory of mind. Some would often say I am an old man at heart and have old ways. I find that older generations knows what true love really is. Is it a reality that all married couples cheat. I don't......and never have. I am a single African American male that is very proud of who I am as well as where I have come from and am going. I am open to all races and ethnicities. I to enjoy the better things in life. I am highly in to fashion and love business attire and business casual wear. I have reached a level in my life and as I grow older and wiser I will continue to reach new levels. All of which allow me an abundance of great things that the Lord has in store for me. For now I am not going to send a picture. It is not that I am an ugly male by far. The fact is I would love to stimulate my women mind as my appearance will only accent what may be believed to be an illusion. A female that can stimulate my mind and one in which I can learn from is oh so beautiful. I would also like to find a women that knows God. The Lord is a strong force in my life. I am far from a angel, but glad to say when I die I know where I'll be. I could right pages and pages of who, I am what I want and what I have to offer, but I would like to hear back from you first. I hope that my ad interest you and I will be waiting to hear from you.

title: Don't open this message!
text:
Hello,

Myself, 36. Indian. Been in the US for 10 years now. No six pack abs, some love handles. Though I am working on loosing them, but still won't try hard enough for six packs.

I don't read much. I just wait for the movie to come out. Television, I do watch. Specially when I am not home. Being from India, I love Indian music. Western pop is on my playlist too. Love listening to Jazz though.

I don't do gardening. I can't even keep my grass alive! I would say, I have no hobbies. Recently, though I picked up crosswords.

title: Coming into town on business, looking to check out a brewery!
text:
Heyoo, I'm a twenty-four year old guy from NC who will be on business in DC this Sunday (4/18) through Monday afternoon and has no idea how to word an ad on Craigslist.

Even though making a post looking for someone to grab a drink or two with on Craigslist feels super bizarre, I'm here doing it anyway. I like craft breweries and I know there are a few in the southwest quadrant of the city (which is close to where I'll be staying) (I hope?). If there is any other living people on the other side of this website and they like breweries in the southwest quadrant of the city too, and don't mind having a really awkward conversation while I hold my glass in front of my mouth as an excuse not to say something embarrassing, you should reply to this post and do the aforementioned things with me (the poster).

Here's what I can promise you out of agreeing to sit in a brewery together
1) Lots of awkward silences
2) Mundane Small talk
3) Me not knowing what to do with my hands
4) Pulling my phone out to check it but then putting it away again because that's probably rude
5) Willing to give you a safe space of five feet at all times, and will definitely understand if you leave early.
6) Will arrive early and sit like some lonely weirdo so you can swerve outta' there if you're not feeling it.
7) Will pay for up to two (2) beers on your behalf.

Anyway you should send an email and just so I know you aren't some scam trying to destroy my ego and my bank account, you should also name three vegetables that start with a vowel. I just tried and succeeded so don't even tell me there aren't at least three.

As an added bonus, I will also send you a picture of my face so you can be judgmental, but still anonymous. The only catch is, you also have to supply a picture of your face too. That's what's called negotiation.

title: What is a Father Figure?
text:
Did you have a father at home when you were growing up? Do you miss having an older man around now that you are an adult and on your own? A Father Figure is not a father, but he is an older man whom you admire and trust. He is someone to whom you can tell your secrets, your frustrations, and your desires. He is a man who is proud of you, concerned for you, and who enjoys hearing about what is going on in your life.

A Father Figure is knowledgeable, stable, and successful. He has a breadth of experience and interests that span a wide range of subjects from art and literature to science and engineering. He enjoys mentoring you, guiding you, and encouraging you; and he will provide a firm hand when he feels you are heading in the wrong direction.

A Father Figure may have a daughter of his own; but having been nurtured by him all her life, his own daughter has now reached an age when she is becoming independent and no longer needs her father's guidance. For this reason, he seeks a young woman like you to whom he can direct his attention, his affection, and his paternal guidance. 

A Father Figure is not a sugar daddy. The affection and respect that a Father Figure and his girl share for each other is strong and mutual. There is no artificial imbalance that needs to be corrected with money, gifts, or favors.

A Father Figure is not a boyfriend. Although the two of you may have a strong attraction to each other, and you may enjoy cuddling with him and feeling safe in his arms, he is a busy man with a demanding job and a family of his own. He looks forward to the time he can spend with you, but his time is limited. For this reason, a Father Figure encourages you to have boys in your life as long as you are open and honest about what you do with them.

A Father Figure is not a slouch or a couch-potato with a beer gut. Despite a few gray hairs, he is strong, healthy, slender, fit, and athletic; and he has a great deal of respect for a girl who takes care of her body and keeps herself in good shape.

A Father Figure is not a pen-pal or a long-distance lover. He wants to see your face and hear your voice and hold your hand. You'll need to be local to the DC area and able to meet him in the city or the close-in suburbs.

If this sounds appealing, send me a note explaining your situation and why you think this might work. The more details you can provide, the easier it will be to distinguish you from the spam.

title: Nice guy for friends, a date or ltr m4m
text:
It's been almost a year and a half since I came out to my family. I never felt comfortable dating or meeting people and hiding from them at the same time. Now that i feel stress free and comfortable, i'd like to meet great people and make friends and of course, meet the one that will sweep my feet off the ground. Though coming out would make it easy, it hasn't been the case. Probably its me for not being that much social, or having a big circle of friends. But still, been single since ever (haha)
Not really into bars or clubbing. More of a home guy and great time with friends. 
It's come to the time where I am always questioning whether I would ever meet someone, or why is it that I can't feel happy with the things I do.
Consider myself a good hearted person that finds pleasure in helping others and knowing that I brought a smile in their faces. We all have likes, and respecting that is a must. I am a man, and like a man being a man! I am just a regular guy, masculine that likes to do guy's things, yet I'm the guy that would cry seeing those viral videos of people helping others, doing great deeds or a song with a inspiring message
Ideally, I'd like to meet someone that will encourage me to do things i haven't done. An outgoing guy that would enjoy a walk in D.C, going to the movies, or just staying in, go for a hike, a road trip or a diner. Someone that would bring me out of my comfort zone... Many of these things I don't get to do them often.
Very polite guy, raised and educated with moral values and taught to appreciate what I have. Have just started school, taking it slow as my job takes the majority of my time. It's a long way to go, but confident that will reach the goal. An Avgeek, commercial airliner, airplane obsessed and world traveler.. (no, not a FA) 
Have a job that I love, but stress me a bit. Trying to find ways to forget about job stress and have a great time with new friends or a date, why not? Enjoy traveling the world! I haven't visited many cities in the US and would be great to have travel buddies! but there are places that are just a mazing when visited with that one person you feel for.
I don't discriminate in any way, but people around my age would be great to meet!! Enthusiastic and always eager to try new things. Also, I respect the way you are, but really not compatible with a fem guy. I am a man, that likes to do men's things and hoping to meet someone like that.
Not consider myself as the best looking guy, but guess I am ok... Latino tan skinned. Have been told I've got a nice smile. not so tall, 5'7 and neither a big guy or skinny guy.
I am always open to suggestions, making new friends and definitely advises on how to meet a good guy (ha).
Have a good one!

title: Older penpal
text:
So I'm deciding to take the plunge and go from being a CL lurker to CL poster. I've gone back and forth on whether or not I should even bother making this post, but oh well, here it goes! Fortune favours the bold, and all that.

I'm looking for an older man to be my penpal and help pass the time while I slave away at my tedious and boring job. I work from home and although the commute is great (heh), I miss the daily interaction with other human beings and the playful, flirty banter of the traditional office. I've tried speaking with the mailman whenever he comes by but he's always in such a hurry, almost as if he has other places to be or something.

So anyway, I'm looking to swap stories, fantasies, links to some porn images (if that's your thing, it's certainly mine); basically have something to look forward to in my inbox other than bills and offers on vacation deals.

Why an older man, you ask? Well, because I'm attracted to much older men and find that I just enjoy speaking with them more. (I'm 23)

To be explicitly clear, I'm NOT looking for:
- a long term relationship
- some NSA hookup
- a sugar daddy (I'm gainfully employed and independent, no desire to change that)
- to meet up for a: coffee, chat, movie, massage, concert, cribbage game, lawn bowling tournament, archery contest, etc
- to talk on the phone or kik or snapchat or whatever other social media outlet is currently all the rage
- to swap pictures of our genitals and/or other body parts

Yes, in answer to your inevitable question, I am real. I mean, I suppose this entire universe could all be an elaborate simulation and we're all just a collection of ones and zeros on someone's computer and nothing is "real", but I'm real in the sense that I am who I claim to be. I figure most people would assume this is some kind of scam or fraud, because well....this is Craigslist after all and we all know what it's like. But no, I'm just bored, lonely, inquisitive and looking to add a little spice to my otherwise boring and predictable life. I can't guarantee I'll email every single day, as work and life sometimes get busy and bills do apparently need to be paid, but I will genuinely make the effort to reach out if you do as well.

So, are you interested? Are you also looking for some inbox excitement? Does this even make any sense whatsoever? Should I stop rambling? Probably?

Well, let's let this thing float out into the CL ether and see what happens.

Have a wonderful day!

title: Gardening Help NEEDED. . .
text:
Do you love to garden, getting your hands and clothes dirty? Do you love the sun and getting hot and sweaty? I love seeing a handsome man shirtless and glistening with sweat in the garden. This is not a sex ad but if it develops I will not turn it down; it is just not a given! Having an extra pair of hands in the yard would be greatly appreciated. Here's a short list of what is entailed. . . pull weeds from existing flower beds, define and shape these beds, mulch, clear back fence and wall from overgrown ivy, rebuild retaining wall from sloped garden bed, re-terrace hill flower bed, and trim trees (from step ladder only). I was hoping to have this finished by now. I have had a set back with weakness in my hands and arms. I go to physical therapy 2 times per week to help strengthen them. It is a slow process.
The house is located in Spring Valley along Massachusetts Avenue which is between American University main campus and Western Avenue NW. There is a Starbucks, Crate & Barrel and CVS nearby.
What I can offer. . .
I am 59, gay, white, single, undetectable, 5'9", 165, smooth, medium build, br, br. I do not use drugs, do not consume alcohol, and do not smoke. Camaraderie, friendship, manly bonding, team work, conversation, and laughter. I will provide food, drinks such as water and coffee, you can use the shower when we are done for the day to freshen up. If we connect maybe shower together to save water! I love kissing, body contact, touching, and more.
You are: 22-66, reasonably fit, HWP, Non drug user, no aftershave/cologne, enjoys gardening, getting hands and clothes dirty, sweaty, and willing to help in the gardens. Face/Full Body photo required for reply.

title: Honesty
text:
I am posting in this forum in hopes to eliminate the guys who respond looking to hook up in such a crass manner that makes me wonder how many women really respond.
I am not interested in making a married man feel desired again. I know how to take care of a man. I know what man wants and needs. If the man is not getting what he wants at home, who is to blame? It takes two to tango.
I was in a relationship with a man for almost two years. I man who is married but he told me he was single. I feel sick about this.
I need honesty. I am honest and I am loyal and a married man who comes to me lacks both. No excuses.
My goal in life is to live my best life now. I want that for all people. I want love, sex, passion, great conversation, honesty, loyalty, compassion. I don't want marriage. I don't want someone moving in with me. I value my freedom, space, independence. 
I will get asked what I look like so here is my description. I'm in my early 40's but look about 30. I am 5 feet, curvy, dark brown hair, dark brown eyes, light brown skin, great smile. I am also intelligent, always described as sweet, sexy.
My interests vary. I am spiritual but not overly religious. I read the bible daily as a reminder that I want to walk in the path of righteousness. I am part sinner and saint. I love being good to people. I listen to Jonathan Foust often. Love him! I love all things earth. I am an earth sign. I chase the sun. I am monogamous by nature. Not into threeseomes or polyamourous and strictly heterosexual. I figure I may as well lay it all on the table. 
I am an open book and will only accept an open book relationship. I am stable and not hung up on what happened in the past and I expect the same in my partner. 
I am not into crowds and don't need to be the life of the party. I am not interested in meeting friends and family or introducing my partner to mine unless I am really sure. I am quirky and goofy and funny. I love to laugh! I will admit I am crazy but in a good way and I say if you find someone who accepts your crazy they are a keeper.
I work full time and am not looking for a sugar daddy or someone to pay my bills. I do love flowers though and romantic gestures. A man who opens the door for a lady is sexy. A man who allows a lady to hook her arm in his while walking is sexy. A man who knows what it truly is to be a man is sexy. 
One of my favorite movies is American Hustle. At this point in my life I am like Amy Adams when she says, no more bull shit. 
I love movies and music too and reading.
Have a great day!!

title: Married man looking for woman in the same situation
text:
I am a 47 married, white male and I'll go strait to the point! 
It's a familiar story I am sure, but I have become frustrated with a complete lack of a sex life. I love my wife very much, and don't want to leave her. However; we are only intimate maybe 2-3 times a month And that simply won't work anymore. I have a very high sex drive, and hers is all but disappeared. 
I am looking for a woman in a similar situation, preferably married as well, but will consider not married. I am not looking to rush into it either, we can chat and get to know each other for a while. But really I am looking for a friend that isn't looking to change their situation or mine. 
If interested send me a reply and we can chat more.
Thank you!

title: Sociable guy with no friends seeks friends
text:
No friends in the greater DC area. They're scattered elsewhere. Similar story for you? Perhaps not the case but you could use another friend who is hilarious and exceedingly amazing in every conceivable category who has unlimited energy, zest, and enthusiasm for going out-- and life in general?

Let's have heart-to-hearts, spa days, lifting days, ratchet club nights (most important!), and perhaps a few swanky soirees where we help each other network or pose as the other's irresistible +1.

I love fitness, boxing and mixed martial arts, traveling, reading, and legal, military, and computer science literature/cutting-edge topics. I also enjoy classic and surreal literature as well as incredibly inane cinema. Tired of going out solo, which is a shame cuz my feet are damned loose. Bring me along, and the party follows. Let's get a conversation going and become homies in no time.

title: I need a CONCERT BUDDY!
text:
Please only respond if you are a girl (aka female) between the ages of 16 and 22. (I'm an 18 year old girl so it would be kind of weird if I was going to concerts with 28 year old guys also my boyfriend would hate that)

Are you sick and tired of always missing that concert you really wanted to go to because you can't find anyone to go with?
Do you wish you could find that one person who's always down for a night of music and dancing?

Then look no further, because that person is ME;
I'm 18, live in Silver Spring, and all of my "friends" are really flaky when it comes to concerts. Concerts are one of the top 3 things that make me genuinely happy and I would love to find that one concert buddy who would love to go to them regularly. I love electronic/dance music, hiphop/rap, korean music (kpop), and post hardcore/alternative bands. 

So if you like one or more of the artists below, then we might have a similar music taste and if you like dancing then we should go to concerts together!

title: Blackmail Game?
text:
Hello. I am looking for someone to have some fun playing a blackmail game. :-) Can be either the "blackmailer" or the "blackmailee". The game can be flexible and a lot of fun. 

The rules are:
The "blackmailer" has material on the "blackmailee". 
A time is set for the length of the game.
The "blackmailer" sets up rules and tasks for the 'blackmailee".
If the "blackmailee" doesn't follow a rule or task, then the "blackmailer" wins. Otherwise, the "blackmailee" wins.

title: Hiking/Traveling/ Sports Partner Needed
text:
Hello--


My name is Derek. I have recently moved back to the area from Las Vegas. I grew up in Washington DC and now it seems that all of my old friends have gotten married and moved on. I am looking to meet new people of any and all backgrounds. I have included a picture of myself so that you can see what I look like. I own a tax consulting business. I have a fair amount of time on my hands but no one to share that time with. Just today I was wishing to go down to the Shenandoah area to go hiking but at this point in my life I am tired of doing things alone. I have also played tennis for 20 years, basketball, badminton, you name it. 

I have a 3 year old Foxhound named Benji that I love dearly. Like I said, I do taxes from home so I am alone quite a bit. Its lonely so that is my primary reason for trying to meet new people. I have had the great opportunity to travel all over. At last count, I have visited 36 states. My goal is to see the last 14 in the next 3-4 years. I should mention that I love Indian, Thai, Italian and French cuisine; not necessarily in that order. :) I hope to hear from you soon.

Derek
